text: Pite na miejscu w browarze. Próbka młodego 18 miesięcznego lambika. Kwaśne, orzeźwiające, czuć dzikie drożdże, jest stajnia, ale brak beczki i zbyt przypomina białe wino.
18 month lambic directly from the barrel at Cantillon. Dusty, barnyard, funky barley. Taste is dusty barley turning to roasty oak. Tart finish. Good

A: Light straw with no head
N: Hints of lactic full-on sourness
T: Brilliant mix of sour complexity. Plenty of tannins grip the tongue
P: Thin
O: Great lambic, quite bitter, which works well

Wyglad: trochę mętne, ciemnoslomkowe, biała drobnopecherzykowa piana - znika po chwili
Aromat: stajnia, dziko, cytrusy, debina
Smak: przyjemne, trochę kwaskowe, jest dziko, beczka, debina, trochę cierpkie

Tap @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours orange with minimum head. Aroma is berries, mould, old cellar, some acid, oak, some juice. Taste is sour, oak, wood, cellar, some bitterness, light metal, some fruits, bark. Nice beer!

On tap at DeTolly. Pours golden yellow colour. No head. Slight barnyard, apples, hints of vanilla, woody, sour notes in the aroma. Apples, woody notes, sourness, funk, very slight spicy notes. Dry, bitter finish. Really enjoyable light bodied brew. No carbonation.

Pours slightly hazy (dark) golden, no head. Aroma: Fresh cow shit with his own juices ;) , grapes, weak vinegar, hay. Taste: medium sour, weak bitter, berries, some juicyness,oak,raw apple peals. Medium body. Bitter sour finish. Nice and different with his nice bitterness. No carbo.
Pitcher pour at the source. The beer is a moderately hazy copper with almost bo head. The aroma is dry and floral. Moderately earthy and funky. Medium tartness. Medium body and no carbonation.
Zwanze day 2016 at Nøgne Ø. Golden color with a white head. Aroma is sourness, yeast. Flavor is sourness, yeast, funk, acidic, fruit, lemon, floral. Need more storage.
Tap @ Koelschip Copenhagen 3/1-17. Nice starter Tones and Nice after taste!

Bag in box. A hazy golden beer with no head. The aroma has notes of brettanomyces, funk, malt, and lemons. The flavor is sour with notes of brettanomyces, funk, lemons, and malt, leading to a tart finish.

Bag in a [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - golden pour with no head. Aroma and taste is sour fruity with notes of citrus, some light lemon, some grapes, straw, with some nice funky notes, grapeskin, light grass, tart fruity finish.

Pour from a bag in a box (!) at the Shelton Brothers Festival. Labeled as "2-year classic maturation lambic aged in sixth-use barrels" on the festival list, and "lambic 2 years old classic maturation" at the table. So thats what this version was, two-year-old lambic. It pours a clearer gold than the Armagnac and Meursault barrel-aged ones, but also with no head. Notes of lemon, lime, grass, grapes, leaves, herbs, oak, cheesecloth, faint sulphurs, and dry grains. Light-medium bodied, with low carbonation and a dry, tart, kind of bitter mouthfeel. Id put this as my second favorite of the three. Interesting stuff.

At the brewery, hazy cutrus orange color, aroma of apples, light spiciness and some minerals, quite tart and a bit coarse, even a bit of a hot sensation, ,some tannins, feels a bit heavy. Interesting.

Sample @brewery. Pours slightly hazy yellow, no head. Funk, barnyard, light citric notes in aroma. Taste is lightly sweet at first, than citric and funky, not that much as in older ones. Medium body, quite dry, citric finish.
On tap at Zwanze day 2016, Butchers Tears. Semi-hazy orange pour with no head and no carbonation. Notes of lambic funk, leather, horse blanket, light sulphur, stinky cheese.

2 year old draught at Tribaun, Innsbruck. 
Dark golden, moderate hazy body, with a tiny head.
Tart aroma of funk, horse blanket, unripe pears, leather, sour citrus, green apples, cheese, barrel.
Taste follows this pretty much, also tart and dry.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a low carbonation.
Finishes sour, tart, dry, with pears, wood, apples, leather, funk.

Nice one. Really sour and dry, with a lot of aged character. Im just missing some carbonation, feels quite flat in the mouth. Overall interesting stuff, while not among my favourite Cantillons.
UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich, Zwanze 2016. Funky and earthy, lots of stable. Very low carbonation, almost no sweetness left. Medium body though. Nice.

On tap at Himmeriget, Zwanze day. Pours a clearish golden with no head. Sweet and sour with aromas of sour grapes with hints of vanilla. Also notes of white wine and cask wood. Medium to light bodied. No carbonation. Dry and sour finish.
Hazy golden with no head. Barnyard, cheese, wood, grass. Flat, mild sweet, medium sour. Long finish. Good.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2016 13-08-15 // sample at the brewery. 18months aged. No carbonation. Very dry sour. Funky and earthy.

03-11-16 // sample at the brwery. Almost 1 year aged. Some bubbles on top. Dry sour.

From the cask, aged 18 months. Tasted at the brewery, poured from a jug into a Cantillon tasting glass. It was a clear dark golden orange colour with no head and no lacing. Aromas were funky and sour with hints of wood and lemon. Tastes sour, tart and funky with a touch of hay and lemon zest. Light bodied with pretty much no carbonation. Overall quite nice, but I tend to prefer at least a bit of carbonation.

Tasting at Cantillon. Pours a clear orange with no head. Aromas of funk, cellar, soil, floral and herbal notes. Taste is funky and earthy and slightly floral. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with no carbonation. Very good!

From small 5 liter boxes @ In De Wildeman. 1, 2 & 3 years old next to each other (from old to young). All: color is deep golden, hazy. No head. Aromas - 3 years: sour, wood, light funk, somewhat fruity? / 2 years: milder, less sour, light sweetness / 1 year: somewhat vegetal, sulphur. Retronasal - 3: sour, tart, wood, still rather mild, later a bit of cardboard / 2: some grain, sourish-sweetish / 1: sourish, light wood, soft. Flavor - 3: quite sour with light bitterness / 2 & 1: mmoderate sour, moderate bitter. All light bodied, 1 year was the only one with some carbonation. Finish is rather dry, tart, with some bitterness in 2 & 1. A blend of the 3 came out second, after 1 & 2, but the 3 year-old version stood out by far.
Duft frisk syrlig æble funk stal hø halm , smag citrus lime frisk svag tør æble cider

Pues probé esto en la visita a la fábrica de cantillon en Bruselas. Es increíble, parece un mosto o sidra, su gran complejidad, acidez y ligereza hacen que esta sea una de las cervezas más delicadas que he probado y además sea muy muy bebible.
18 months. A little flat in my opinion - though I had it right after a much stronger tasting beer, so perhaps it was just flat in comparision. Decent funky smell.
Unclear light orange gold. No head. No carbonation. Light body. Moderate sour. Dry. Dusty. Cowwebby. Woody. Lemon. Well crafted as youd expect.
Gold, orange colored body. Very nice mouthfeel. Less complexity than the regular gueze but a great beer to drink.

Sampled at the brewery May 2016. Unclear golden orange body, practically without any head. Aroma is funky, fruity and acidic with a little apple cider in it. Flavor is sour and acidic with some fruit, wood and Brett. Its surprisingly smooth and rather less acidic and sour than the Geuze, this goes for the complexity as well, pretty straight forward without the depth and richness from a Geuze. At the same time you can detect the basic elements and knowing your Geuze its interesting to sample the basic ingredients. Also a big plus to sample this at the brewery. This is highly enjoyable, but to be honest, if someone just poured this into my glass as an apple cider or something the score would probably be a bit lower. Honesty is crap sometimes.

Hand-pumped and foam-vaporised full draughts at Moeder Lambiek 2015 and 2016-IV, 12m-18m. - Pumped clear golden yellow and foamy (!). Lovely cheesy lemon balm and grapefruit juice in aroma, pierced by soft white balsamico sulphurs, white peach and lemon. Taste develops into sweeter lemon juice with old cheesy citrus rind from the old hops, then must throwing a dusty, slightly sulphuric wet blanket over all that, leaving on a pure lemon juice prickle in the throat. - Not quite as meaty, oily and complex as my all-time favourite G.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Przeklejka wyjazdowa, pite w browarze: Unblended Lambic (2015) 16 months oldBrasserie CantillonMega wytrawne, malo kwasne, ciekawie owocowe, po ogrzaniu milo dzikawePS: jako kwachowy abnegat, jestem w szoku, ze taki swiezy, unblended, jest dla mnie fajniejszy niz te wszystkie lezaki, cuda niewidy :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Sample at brewerys tasting room. Pours pale, light and not much foam. Aroma has some autumn funk going on, not that sour. Tastes also nicely smooth, some funk and a bit of sour. Sipped this one for quite long, nice and enjoyable when maybe simple lambic. Basic and solid.
18 months sample, in the brewery tasting room. My first Cantillon beer, just blew my mind. Awesome.
From a jug at the brewery. Orange gold. Very light haze. No head. A tad cheesy. Some wood. Soft funk. Taste is dry mostly, with a little sweetness on the lips. Softly acidic. Dries out. Very nice.
From a jug @ Cantillon, Brussels 15/5-15. 16-18 month old. Fruity and bretty with leather and horseblanket.
At Cantillon. Golden without head or carbo. Hay, cheese, white wine. Sour, salty. Medium body.
Sampled at Cantillon Brewery. Golden, flat, a bit hazy. Lots of Brettanomyces notes in aroma, fruits, white wine. Moderately sour, fruity, vinous, hints of astringent bitterness. Very good.
@ Moeder Lambic 15-10-30: Helt utan kolsyra, mycket trevliga och stora toner av vindruvor. Underbar balans. Otroligt gott
Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Orange with almost no head. Funky with grapes, oak and light apples. Soft and easy to drink with no carbonation. A tasty one
Cask @ Moeder Lambic, Brussels. Unclear yellow body with a medium white head. Dusty, cobwebs, oak, funky, almonds, tartness.

1, 2, and 3 year lambic poured from boxes. 1 year is much paler than 2 and 3 year. No head. 1 year is soft and almost sweet smelling. Straw and wheat. Low acidity. 2 year smells almost vinegary and oaky. 3 year is extremely oaky and yogurty. Tastes are dramatically different as well. 1 year has some sweetness with straw and grain. 2 year is extremely sour. 3 year is an incredibly complex lambic. Oak is prevalent. Moderate acidity, but less than I expected. Funky and yogurty tartness. All are flat and medium light in body. Fantastic experience to try these three components next to the gueuze they are blended into. They are interesting to taste, but the refinement of the gueuze they become belies their abrasive characteristics.

Straw yellow pour. No carbonation. Some lacing. Lemon peel and white wine grape tartness. Aroma had lemon and oak. Nice lambic but not too sour. Mellow in comparison. Very nice drinker with the tart and barnyard. Very nice.
From cask at Moeder Lambic! Aroma of light fruits, very light funk, apricots?. Taste is sour and tart, light oak, fruits, funk, of course no carbonation. Very high drinkability!
Cask at moeder. Pours hazy orange with a bubbly white head. Aroma tart, barn, green apples, quite complex, grape, leather.

Cask at the source. Brown orange color without much carbonation. Watery and bland flavor profile with wet oak, basement funk, and light leather being noticed. A touch sweet. This was the 18 month old jawn I reckon.

Pours deep golden. Aroma if malt, lemon , fruitiness, some floral notes and sour grapes. Medium body.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2015 Cask @ brewery, 18 months old. Pours a hale orange with no head. Aroma is barnyard, some appleskin. Taste is more appleskin. Not too sour, no carbonation. Not too pleasant really. 7-3-7-3-13

Cask @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, vintage 2011. Pours a hale orange with a large-bubbled head. Aroma is sourly fruity, barnyard, some appleskin. Taste is sour, perfumey, barnyard, lavender perfume. 8-3-8-15

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Sep 2015 - From bottle (I think) at GBBF. Thanks! Hazy orange, still, no real head. Aroma is dirty and lemony, dried apricots, tangy sourness. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is apples, lemon, dry and sour, punchy sourness with a tangy, boozey, harsh finish. Bit acidic for me. (3.4)
Mar 2017 - From the jug at Cantillon, free as part of the tour.  Unblended 15 month old lambic.  Golden orange, still, no head.  Aroma is quite cidery.  Body is smooth with soft to low carbonation.  Taste is similar  lightly acidic cider.  Decent.  (3.3)

Cantillon lambik on tap at Moeder it was a fairly clear gold with a soapy white head. The taste was sharply sour and metallic giving me lemon tartness in the finish but I felt it needed more age. Jonge 3 while a few days later at the brewery I had the 18 month old version - it was way way better. It was a bright clear gold. The taste was lightly tart with a bit of the horsey Brett. Oude 3.9
Cask at cantillon (18months)bright hazy amber gold with Sharp lactic and lemon juice nose. Soft, sour, earthy, low brett, lacto driven. Thin, flat
Bottle at cantillon, apparently straight out the barrel, 18 months. Pours clear golden, nose is light funk, oak, taste is tart, funky, little sweet.
Green apple and nice cedar stale hop aroma. Dry crisp champgne like and sour Sauvignon blanc character. Some oak in flavor and so dry and refreshing. Great style and brewery.

Sampled at the Cantillon brewery, Brussels.
Sample was 16 mounths old. No head. Solid golden color and almost perfectly clear. Wood, pepper and stable aroma. Dry and a bit tart. The taste is like a mix between still cider and dry white wine but with a small bitterness. Fresh.
Old wood wet towels and huge light fruity tart aroma. Taste of tart cherries and lemons with background of wood and yeasty gym socks. In a good way of course :)

Sample at La Soirée des Brasseurs. Clear golden with no head. Aroma is cheesy, barnyard and a definite woody presence. Lactic tartness is pungeant, wood and some lemon. Nice palate, very dry and no carbonation, you really can appreciate Cantillons lambic. Drinks very well.
From 18 month old barrel at Cantillon. Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma heavy acidic, wood and hops. Flavor heavy acidic, light sweet, woody and bitter, ending dry. Light body. Nice.

(18mo from ceramic jug at the brewery, July 25 2015) Pours slightly hazy medium gold with no head. Aroma has tart crabapple, cider and white wine vinegar, wet basement and mulch, some wood, old hops come through a bit with hay. On the palate, moderately acetic, apple vinegar and skin, a little citrus, maybe underripe peaches, oak fairly prominent towards the finish. There are dried leaves in the finish, softly medicinal, funk is dry and dusty. Aftertaste dry and lightly bitter, light bodied. Pretty damn drinkable unblended lambic, maybe a bit more time to get woody would be nice. Think I actually prefer it to the regular gueuze though, in small pours.
Bottle at the brewery . Dry nutty light body. Tart and vinuous. Fanastic Lambic
Had at the brewery after the tour. Straight from the barrel. Mild funk, vinegar. Oaky. A wonderful experience.

Nice really golden color. Bubbly white head that soon vanish. Funky tart green apples, some vinegar and oak in the aroma. Medium body and a quite flat carbonation. Nice balance between sweetness and acidity. Sour tart green apples, fruity, vinegar and oak in the flavor. Not the best from this brewery, but quite nice a summer evening.[Bottle (16 months) from a trade with Martinus]
Sample in Cantillon Brewery. Hazy orange color, no head. Aroma is aciduc, lemon, wine, fruits, funk. Taste is medium sour, dry. Taste of lemon, wine, rich and complex. Aftertaste dry and tart.

Poured from a jug at the end of the Cantillon tour in Brussels. Hazy Gold with no trace of head. Sour aroma of festering spilled wine. Lemony sour with nae sweetness and puckering acidity. Very dry and refreshing. Just what I wanted after the tour.

End of tour tasting pour. Mostly clear yellow orange, uncarbonated; no head and no lacing. Aroma is refined and funky, oaky, horse blanket. Flavor is dry dry dry, light tartness and light plus funk, a lot of oak character. Yummy.

Cask au Moeder Fontaines, Lambic 2 ans. Couleur dorée trouble, imposante mousse blanche nuageuse et tenace. Arôme de cuir, levure sauvage, acidité, paille humide, soupçon de citron. Goût de levure sauvage, bonne acidité, fermier, un peu damertume. Absence de carbonatation, corps moyen.
From a jug @ Cantillon, Brussels 150515. 17-18 months old. Fruity and bretty with light woody notes, sour and flat, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry, sour and fruity.

4 Year Old aged in old 50N4E barrels served at Wild Friendship event. Still. Musty wet basement, leather, some wet hay, bitter orange pith, beeswax, old wood, earthy mushroom, slight sweet undertone on the backend. Interesting.

Poured at the WFB event. 4 years old. 
Aroma is very nice with a nice, earthy, herbal, funkiness. Acidity is soft with a bit of a cheesiness. Good oak character. Light citrus and tropical fruit. Some good stone fruit notes as well. A bit vinous. 
Pours a slightly hazy, golden orange with no head and no lacing. Faint legs. 
Flavor is fairly acidic with a nice earthy and slightly sharp acidity. Some herbal notes with quite a bit of oak. Faint tropical and stone fruit. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with almost no carbonation. Low astringency and no alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice lambic with a lot of oak, but it also shows a bit of oxidation. Good, mellow acidity.
Over two years old, great lambic. Very sour, very complex nose and a long, long finish. Fantastic beer, one of the best geuzes around.

Cantillon brewery. 16 moths.
Appearance: No head, slightly hazy and golden.
Aroma: sour cellar
Taste: sour apricot, slightly bitter, dry taste and no bubbles. Nice long finish

From barrel at the brewery. 
Pours flat and slightly hazy golden. 
Aroma of fall leaves and cellar. 
Taste of lemon,earwax and apricot.
Wine glass from tap at Cantillon brewery. OK, my first experience with this thing. First impression is quite sour. The last impression is somewhat less sour, but this quite sour. Interesting.

1.5 years old (sorta medium old) at the brewery. Orange color with no head. Funk and wood in the aroma. Dry and light. Sourness is held back. Not too complex, but just good. Decent amount of bitterness in the Flat carbonation. Nice.

Glass at the brewery. Pours clear gold with small, fizzy edge bubbles. Aroma is earthy, farmhouse, and lactic bacteria with stale hops, lemon notes and an old oak character. Flavor is tart and puckering lemon and lactic acidity, oak, stale hops and a dry finish. Light body and nearly still.
0,3l on tap @ Pikkulintu, three years old. Pours clear pale golden with no head. Aroma is very sour malts. Flavor is sour malts too. No carbonation. Good.
Gold, slightly cloudy pour with no head or fizz. Winey, funky, barnyard aromas. Taste is winey, sour. Call me a bloody savage but its just not my cup of tea.
Glass at brewery. Clear golden colour without head. Winey aroma. Soft sourness followed by mild bitterness.
At antwerp bierkunske, tingling carbonation, tart, funky, wheaty, complex yet drinkable.

Glass at brewery. One year old blend. Flat head, quite hazy. Aroma is straw, citrus and light of wood. Gives a checimal feeling in the mouth, leaving a layer for a second. Taste is sour with a sense of nail polish.
Cask @ Moeder Lambic. Clear golden pour with tiny lacings on top. Lots of funk, lemon, hay, wheat and some vegetables. Nice and refreshing!
goldish yellow, hazy, no foam; complex aroma, lots of fruits, mostly grapes, apples, citrus; high sourness, lightly sweet and bitter, dry in general; light body, thin feel, no carbonation

Sampled at Borefts 2014. Pours clear dark golden with no head. Aroma is dusty, dank, wood, light funky and a little tart fruity. Flavour is light moderate sweet and acidic. Medium bodied with flat carbonation.
Borefts 2014. Poured dark golden with no head. Aroma of tart fruit. Medium body, quite zesty, flavour is tart and quite sweet, pretty smooth.

There was some confusion over where to rate this, but I think its right here. Its Bruocsella with a different aging, as I was told. Anyway. Served headless, orange body. Aged, woody, dusty, refined, soft malts, barn. Sot sourness, too mellow for my taste buds. Good but doesnt live up to the hype I think. Not for me at least. (On tap at Borefts 2014)
sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: klares oranges Bier mit wenig Schaum. Geruch nach reifen Früchten, holzig, säuerlich. Geschmack säuerlich, reifes Obst, holzig.
sample at bbf. poured a flat golden colour. citrus, lactic, acid, horse blanket, slight oxidiced. tart, intense vinous earth tones. no carbonation. but boy i liked this

At Borefts 14. Clear golden colour, no head. Aroma of light oxidization, tart, citrus, lemons, some funk. Flavour is light floral, funky, tart, slightly oxidized, sour finish. Light-bodied. Not for me.
Bottle @ Borefts 2014. Copper colored, with no head. Intense sour taste, very tardy, the term horseblanket is appropriate. Bit earthy as well. Great lambic.
Sampled @ Borefts 14. Clear yellow to orange colour with no head. Smells sour, dusty, wild yeast. Tastes sour, wild yeast, cork. Medium body, soft carbo.
golden colour. aroma bit of sulphur like burnt plastic and hay. taste was mellow citric acid, bit of sulphur, more hay with a dry finish. very slick oily mouthfeel. nice.  draft @ cantillon

@ Brasserie Cantillon - 18 mois dage.
Blonde doree sans carbonation ni collet.
Des aromes aigres et vineux.
Le vin dorge par excellence, pas de petillement en bouche, le cote aigre qui ressort pas mal (il faut etre habitue...), notes boises.
Interressant mais cest tout de meme pas ma tasse de the

18 month old I blended Lambic at Cantillon brewery with Kimberly and Taylor. Aroma is young cantillon funk, a little empty compared to the oude Gueuze. Taste is not as dry as most all other cantillon, and a little watery, wheat notes still present. Almost zero acidity. I could pound this all day, easy. Love.

At Cantillon, june 18th. 18 months old. Pours hazy yellow with no head. Aroma is medium barnyard, oak, earthy, citrus and light floral. Taste is medium tart citrus and apples with a rounded smooth barnyard and earthy note, lingering medium tartness. Smooth creamy texture.

Jar @ Cantillon Brewery. 18 months old acording to the server. Pours golden with just a few white bubbles along the glasside. Aroma is sour, bretty, malt, dusty, barnyard, grapes, white wine like. Flavor is sour, grapes, apples, white wine, yeasty, dusty, webs, barnyard. Medium body, flat carbonation, lasting sour wine like finish. Great beer, thats very easy to drink. 290714
18 months old at the source. Flat. Sour and so on. Moelleux. Some wood. Very balanced oude lambic. A light oiliness.

Bière quasi plate offrant un nez fleuri, boisé avec une fine acidité développant des esters alcooliques. Le corps est fort boisé, soyeux voire même un peu mielleux avec une amertume moyenne assez acre à la fin.

Drank at the bruery. 18 month old. Good stuff! Pours almost clean amber with almost no head.  Aroma is just clean! Very rural and tart. Moldy oak, leather and weak barnyard. Really natural and nice aroma. Taste is gentle and tart with notes of citrus, oak, weak vinegar and a nice dryness. No carbonation suits this beer. Very romantic and idyllic beer to drink year round.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2014 18 months old at Cantillon. Dark golden with no head. Deep grains with very bitter lemon peel, follow by a sour slightly acidic fruitiness and a strong bitter woody finish. Didn't expect it to be so bitter, but this is pretty good for a non carbonated beer...

From barrel @ the brewery. Pours slightly hazy light amber with barely any head at all. Clear, vinous aroma with touches of yeast and dust. Moderately dusty onset, leading to intense vinous notes and estery touches. No carbonation. Lingering vinous aftertaste. Good.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2017 Re-rate: sample at the brewery: pours cloudy/hazy golden, no head. Fruity, quite sour, some wooden notes, funky, citrus, fruity. Dry finish. 

On tap as Single Barrel 1-Year Lambic at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Golden colored with no head. Bit spicy and fruity and extremely sour. Interesting, but Im not sure Id order another one.  3.4

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2016 On tap @ CASK Pub and Kitchen, Pimlico. Golden orange, flat as flat can be. Scent of kumquat and sourdough. Taste is a citrussy sour, not as funky as a gueuze but more crisp and refreshing. Short finish and aftertaste. Worth a try but not earth-shatteringly complex like a blended lambic.

Tap. Pale golden body with a small white head. Aroma of brett, barnyard, funk and caramel notes. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and average carbb. Sour arom that ends up dry and tart. An excellent Lambik.

Verres, de casks, au t Antwaerps Bierhuyske et à la brasserie. Arômes typiques de Cantillon, beaucoup de pamplemousse blanc et de paille. Robe blonde et légèrement trouble, effervescence très faible et peu de mousse. En bouche, on trouve de très belles notes de lambic portant surtout sur les agrumes (écorce de pamplemousse). Légère présence boisée. Finale très sèche présentant une acidité citrique et lactique dintensité moyenne. Excellent, fort probablement mon vieux lambic préféré.

A- golden yellow with no head. Looks very similar to apple cider.

S- wheat, lemon, tangerine, sourness

T- stars very wheaty and sweet and moves into bitterness that rushes over the tongue finishes with waves of sour, sweet and bitter

M- no carbonation, medium bodied

D- very interesting and multidimensional beer. More of a sensory experience through sour, sweet and bitter than it was complex in flavor profile.
Cask @ Moeder. Chessy butter covered popcorn with brett, barnyard, grapes and apples. mild sour and very drinkable.
At quintessence. Golden-orange colour with no head. Fruity and malty aroma. Sweet, fruity and malty taste. Light to medium body.

Lucky to try a handbottle from 98 (Thanks Cory!) as well as samples at the first Shelton Festival in Worcester.. Super translucent, cider in appearance. Heavy funk and moderate sourness, little to no head or lacing. Very palatable, refreshing and easy to drink- if a bit one dimensional (perhaps thats the point!) Very cool to try this component of our favorite gueuze on its own, really helps pull together the bigger picture of how important the concept of blending is for gueuze. An isolated snapshot of a crucial moment in time for lambik.

Cask at Moeder and from barrel at the brewery. Very nice tasting with a hint of popcorn and butter. kind of interesting taste. and goes down pint after pint. my favorite "regular" of the casks at moeder!

Draught: Served in a Cantillon shaker:
No head, hazy orange colored beer.
Aromas of horseblanket, wild yeast, some wood, some old flowers, hints of soap, hay and a sprinkle of something like honey.
Flavours of light tart, grapes, wood, wild yeast, cheese, light white pepper touch, some smooth dryness, subtle bitterness, light herbs and a sprinkle of something malty...
Aftertaste is tart with wood, cheese, wild yeast and grapes.
No carbo, light watery mouthfeel and texture and a medium to full sublimely balanced body!
Delicious!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Poured from pitcher at the brewery. Pale yellow with almost no carbonation. Aroma is lemon, sour plum, grain, Brett, cider. Awesome. Taste is refreshing bitter lemons and minerality with a surprising full mouthfeel. Gulpable. Great.
At the brewery. Golden lemon with no head. Aroma is dry wheat. Flavour is sour fruit, really drys the back of the mouth. Lingering dry bitterness, some wood in the finish. Very dry.
Sample thanks to 77ships. On draft @t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Pours cloudy orange. Very sour aroma. Taste sour, fruity balanced. Not my thing (yet).

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 On tap @ La Fine Mousse (Paris). Listed as "Jeune Lambic - January 2012" and the appearence fits the criteria of Oude Lambik. Clear deep golden with no head and no lacing. Aroma is cheesy with a important apple presence and barnyard notes. Taste is acidic with apples, barnyard, cheesy notes, lemon and wood. Light to medium body. No carbonation. Woodsy and acidic finish. A tad acrid too. Not as good as the bottled Cantillon Ive tried yet, but still very interesting to try.  8-3-8-4-15

Tried it again from cask at Cantillon (Bruxelles) - 1 year old - and it was not acrid at all, more lemony and more sharp. + 1 overall.

At the brewery. New style for me. Golden in colour with no head, no activity in it. Somehow it manages to look pretty.
Aroma of sour grapes, apples, something else that I cant put my finger on.
Very sour taste on my first big sip, softens later on. Again sour grapes, kind of wine-like taste, tart.
Totally flat as far as carbonation is concerned, tart on the palate, thin body.
Nice and thirst-quenching.

Originally sampled on 01-14-12. 1998 vintage...thanks, Cory!

Pours an amber color, no head, some bubbles here and there. Nose is funky, vinous, some citrus, malty. Flavor is lots of funk, ripe fruits, light tartness, and oak. Light body, no carbonation, dry tart finish.

A real treat with the age, but nothing to go too crazy over. I enjoyed my pour and I didnt really need anymore.
Taster at the brewery. No notes - from memory. Golden, slightly hazy, no head. Gooseberries, sour notes. Very sour flavour.

Drunk on draft at de Herren Van Liedekerke. Superb sharp tasting old lambic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At the brewery, 1 year old. Light hazy gold pour with no head. Aroma is light, light cheesiness, very typical Cantillon funk, clean aroma, much like a mild version of the regular gueuze. Taste is very tart, citric, much more acidic than the 3F I had earlier. Cleaner as well, drier palate, still flat but much more mature. Very enjoyable.

Served on cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. My server told me this was a 2 year old lambic. Two fingers of frothy white head, cloudy orange/yellow in color, good head persistence. Nose is lemon rind, very funky, basement must Taste is subdued lemon tartness, stone fruit, light yogurt. This is a lot more mellow than the gueuze (which my wife was trying while i drank this). Crazy crushable. Light, velvety mouthfeel, light acidity, general lack of carbonation, and a moderate finish. I plan on drinking a lot more of this this trip. Great sessionable lambic.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 20.04.2013, tap (15 months old) @ the brewery:
Frisk lukt med preg av lys malt, humle, sitron, gras, bærskal, sitrusskal. Flat lett beisk smak med preg av lys malt, humle, beiskt gras, syregras, sitrusskal. God bitterhet som set godt. Grei.

[19-OCT-2013] Draught at EurHop Beer Festival (EBF) 2013 in Rome. Pours yellow with no head, aroma of fruits, cherries, vinegar, flavor is grainy and bitter, vinegar, pretty tasty and flat, medium bodied, very nice
Amber orange, flat, no carbonation, no foam. Easy drinkable but full of taste. Bitter and dry beer with sourness. Aroma of green apple. Tart and dry. Very good!

Pours light cloudy yellow amber, low white head. Aroma of green apples and grapes, hay, grass. Taste is balanced tart sour, apples and grapes again. Soft carbonation, dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask at Great British Beer Festival 2013. Poured a cloudy yellow ochre colour with no head. Aroma of tart fruit, bitter peal and lemon juice. Sour fruit flavours mixed with woody, earthy notes. Balanced sour finish.
UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 Draught at Pikkulintu. Pours hazy yellow with medium fast vanishing head. Notes of vinegar, apple, fruits, old socks, citrus. Smooth easy to drink. Very nice.-- bb/wp

Draught @ Pikkulintu. Hazy golden, thin white head. Aroma has apple, earth, malt, sourness. Flavor has green apple, sourness, malt. Very dry finish. Apples dominates this. Not that intensive, but oh the drinkability.

Draught at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Vintage 2011. Pours hazy orange in color with a small head. Slightly funky notes, soft vinegar and some lemony notes in aroma. Tart mouthfeel. Vinegar and green fresh quite sour apples in taste. Not that sour I was expecting but still quite refreshing. High drinkability. Slightly sour finish with some wooden and grapefruit notes in the end.-- bb/wp

Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is deep orange with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dryness, sourness, berries and fruits.

GBBF 2013 backlog. CASK. 

Colour: golden-amber.

Aroma: horse blanket, green plum sourish bitterness.

Taste: quite bitter and not too sour for a lambic, a bit peppery even.

The finish was somewhat watery.

At Moeder Lambic.

A nice unblended lambic not as good as expected but was awesome to drink to the great snacks at Moeder Lambic.
On tap at GBBF 2013. Clear brownish yellow colour. Awesome stuff, very very austere and dry, tart, lemony, funky, some bitterness actually with a bit of hop, lightly woody. Delicious.

From a jug at the brewery. Dark yellow colour no head. Completely flat, no carbonation at all. Very sour, acidic, fruity aroma. Flavour is sour, slighly citric, flat. Difficult to drink and enjoy. You either like it or hate it. Makes you understand why it is normally blended to a gueuze.

Unlabeled 375 bottle, capped not corked. 2010

Poured a beautiful straw yellow. Smell and taste of oak, lemon and ripe fruit. Dry mouthfeel with a nice balance tartness with fresh stone fruit.

Sample at the brewery, 18month old sample. Shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, no foam.
NOSE: wood, little fruity.
TASTE: flat! very dry, fruity, lots of wood, brett, sugars noticeable, but you can hardly say this is a sweet beer. Very nice to drink!

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, 29/04/13. 18 months old according to bar keeps. This ladies and gentlemen .... looks the bollocks !
Lightly hazed golden with a big old frothy white head.
Nose is gras, light dung, lemon rind, cheese, straw, damp wood.
Taste comprises weak but tarte lemon squash, grass, barnyard notesm orange pith, funk, tarte and sour citric notes.
Medium bodied with fine carbonationm light puckerings in the the finish.
Decent but not my favourite from Cantillon by any means.

text: (draught, 15 months) pours a hazy golden colour with no head. aroma of lemon juice, peaches and a hint of acetone, with light notes of physalis, dandelions and nettles. flavour is mostly the same, with some slightly sweet notes of mango and physalis, a light tartness and a very bitter herbal-hoppy finish. medium-bodied with no carbonation.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy golden liquid with small white head. Aroma of barnyard, lemons, white pepper, sweat, funky fruit and apples. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemons, apples and barnyard. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really awesome, delicious.
Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy very nice sour aroma. Moderate bitter great sour flavor. Long heavy sour finish. Creamy palate. Nice.

Draught at Mikkeller and Friends cons 2013-05-04 Köpenhamn
AR: yeasty, tart, apple cider, 
AP: wee hazy, wee frothy cream white head
F:,sourish tart, seeds, grainy, white grapes, white peppery

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, pours a hazy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of tart dry fruits, some wild yeasts, and some barnyard funk. Flavour brings out classic Cantilllon barnyard funk, medium acidity, some slight vinous quality and oak. Highly complex and very authentically lambic-like. Awesome stuff.
(Short review due to the massive amounts of beer I drank during the CBC13.) Very nice and refreshing!

Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Stefansgade, as " Cantillon Lambik 2011". Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, atrt, citrus and a little barnyard. Flavour is malt, fruit, tart, barnyard, citrus and leather.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen

Pours clear orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of sour and tart berries, some blackcurrant and farmyard notes. Taste is sour with tart blackcurrant notes and hints of yeast. Finish is sour and tart. Quite balanced and sour gueuze. Nice.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Stefansgade. Nice head with good duration.  Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, leather, stable, malt and hops. Nice and sour.

En fût @ Dieu du Ciel. Lambic de moins dun an, mais sans sucre résiduel. On y retrouve les caractéristiques acétiques et surettes dun lambic, mais sans la complexité des assemblages. Intéressant pour la compréhension des lambics, mais sans plus.

Guessing its this one. From a jug at the brewery. Poured a slightly slightly hazy golden body. Pleasant vinuous funky peppery aroma. Peppery, salty, actually well balanced taste. Damn juicy. Now this is a lambic I could drink a lot of! Superb stuff!
tap @ Tuulensuu. lightly hazy orange, no head. tart farmhouse aroma. tart, nice flavor.
200213. Tap at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Pours hazy orange with almost no head. Aroma ripe fruit, berries. Peat sour taste. Nice balanced lambic. Not Bad.
Golden color. Sour "bretta" and fruit aroma. At taste is light sour and also bitter, medium bodied and smooth.

Served on-tap at Churchkey on Zwanze day 2012.

A - Pours slightly hazy straw yellow with a small half finger tall bubbly white head, dissipating down to nothing at all, leaving no lace at all down the glass.

S - Smell is pretty muted until it fully warms up. Hints of funky cheese, damp oak, basement must, some lemon zest and a dash of vinegar. 

T - Starts off with a big sour kick that fades as quickly as it hit you leaving behind hints of lemon zest, musty funk, dry oak and a dash of booze burn. Finish is funky with a moderate amount of dryness, doesnt stick around too long tho.

M - Light with very light carbonation. Its has a tart feel but it doest linger for very long, allowing it to be consumed quite easily.

O - I feel like this is exactly what an unblended two year old lambic should taste. Sure its a little rough around the edges, but thats why its perfect for blending and fruit additions. I am glad I got to try this, I look forward to having it again one day, hopefully a little closer to the source.

Draft at Churchkey on Zwanze Day. 2-year old lambic. Light, straw colored amber pour, completely still. Aroma is sour malts, lemony, buttery barnyard funk, mild grapefruit. Taste is lightly tart, lemon and grapefruit chewiness, vinegar and barnyard. Medium light palate, smooth almost creamy feel. Nice lambic, great funkiness, balanced.
Overall: What should one say, its Cantillion.Note: On-tap at Mikkeller Bar. Reviewed 2012-12-01.

On tap at Novare Res Bier café after the yearly Zwanze release. This is 2 years old. (really needs to be older)  Poured a clear golden body with a small ring of lacing from nearly no head. Aroma is funk with Vinegar type sharpness. Rotten wood. Real acidic. This really needs to sit for much more time. With an unblended this was WAY too young for me. Funk, vinegar and moldy basement isnt something Im going to reach for. This was only my 2nd unblended. I love Iris however, that was a 5 year old bottle. This would need to be about that old or older to try again.

Golden burnt orange. 
Huge horse blanket nose. Citrus and lemons and very grassy

Moldy and intense. Living the apple cider vinegar wet grass and pears. 


Totally still and very refreshing.

2 year old. Tap at Churchkey. Grapefruit and lemon nose, very juicy, light cheese and yogurt. Taste is quite sour, lots of funk and cheese, light acetone sweetness. Acetic acid finish. Body is slightly flabby.

Draft at Churchkey. Pours an inert orange brown with little carbonation. Aroma has some funky barnyard and a hint of balsamic vinegar. Flavor is dry woody and lemony.  A bit if funk with lots of tartness. Just a hint of carbonation.

Draft at Churchkey for Zwanze Day 2012. 2 year. Clear light orange pour with no head. Nose and flavor marked by notes of sharp lemon acidity and bite, cheesy and earthy funk, and beautiful woody character. No carbonation but really nice tartness. Lovely stuff.

Ón tap. Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. Acid, barnyard and leather all the way. Great!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Mikkeller Bar,Cph. Hazy golden orange with a creamy, quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is funky, citric apple juice with lemon zest and horse blanket. Very dry, sandpaperish mouthfeel. Dusty applecider taste. Extremely dry light woody finish, tart and almost tannic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph. Pours light hazy pale orange with a small, creamy, white head. Aroma has funk, red apple peel, lemon zest, soft vinegar and a light lactic hint. Low carbonation, dry and almost oily mouthfeel. Flavour is elegantly tart, zesty, soft salt, lemon, apple, light cellar dustiness. Lingering light and dry finish. Yum.

Pours clear gold with no head. Aroma is delicate vinegar, leather, ripe apple, wood, spice, funky. Taste is light sour and light sweet. Body light, texture is watery,carbonation is flat, finishes dry.
From jug at the brewery. Pours hazy orange with no head. Aroma is mandarines, sparkling wine, lambic basement. Flavor is similar, very sour. Nice dry aftertaste.

Handpump, Moeder Lambic.  Pours a beautiful dark gold body with a nice frothy off-white head.  The nose is quite funky and a bit cheesy with some light sugary notes, light touches of woodiness.  The flavor is dry and completely funked out, but distinct from their Gueuze, more sweaty socks and cheesy funkiness, just a touch of light wood.  I love that theres really zero acidity to this, making it very drinkable.  Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with a touch of sweetness but not much, a slight bit of carbonation.  Very interesting to taste the base of it all.

New review. The bottle I had before was suspect. This time, I tried the beer on cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas.

The beer is hazy and copper hued with a thick head. The aroma is funky and fabulous, and of course, embodies that classic Cantillon scent I have come to love. The flavor is fabulous. Earthy, fresh, funky, musty, damp basement, rain, straw, hay, farm. Complex and yet so easy to drink. Light in body but not thin. A wonderful lambic.

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad.

1998 vintage

The beer is transparent and copper to amber in color. No head whatsoever. The aroma brings basement, rain water, funk. The taste is much sweeter than anticipated. A bit of Cantillon funk in the finish, but not to the usual level. Notes of ripe fruit. Overall, this was just ok. I look forward to trying this from the source and comparing to this vintage bottle version.

Serving type: bottle

sampled at the brewery. almost 1 year old ( last winter produced, had in october.. ) 
no foam, carbo ( as it should be) , dry, very dry. sour but very soft-sour. little aftertaste. starting to see a common - cantillon -  taste wich is in all their beers, as well as in this one. nice probably, but im (still? ) not a fan of pure lambik that much as others seem to be

Keg at CPK, London. Two-year old version. Pours clear gold, no head. Good tangy nose, hints of butter, bread, grass. Light sweet with some sturdy sourness, light apples, grass, light tangy fruits. Light bodied with very, very fine carbonation- its almost flat. Very clean, tangy finish, some mild tart berries, light grassy hops. Its a tasty well nuanced beer. I actually dont get much the distinctive, grassy/earthy Cantillon character, but its still good stuff.

Hazy orange pour from the pitcher with no head. Really nice fruitiness of orange, lemon, and green apple. A touch of tropical notes, too. A mild earthy funk, some oak, and very dry. The flavor is a nice blend of sourness and dryness. Some oak along with the lemon and green apple notes. Light fruit character, some grass, straw, and musty barrel.

5l. Plactic Cask@ Gents Bierfestival. Light amber coloured beer with no carbonation and no head. Very special grainy herby and light fruity tart to earthy hinted aroma. Medium rather flat palate. Finish is light tart grainy fruity sweet hinted with a longer more tart ending. Not bad!

Taste at the brewery. Golden with a couple of soapy bubbles. Dry yeasty aroma. Sour white grapes, nice dry brett, subtle, very cool. Juicy sour before drying hop (?) finish. Very tasty base, you can see where they go from here.

As a taster at the brewery. Has a hazy amber colour with no head. Aromas of vinegar, spices, berries, something sweet and fruity, wood, some leather and cloudberries. Pretty sour berries in the flavour along with wood, something floral and dandelion. Flatt and slick mouthfeel, and a very light bitterness. A different lambic experience, and feels both sour and spicy when pretty young.
I much prefer them blended i guess.  Very interesting to try the base here though.  Tart, vinegar, wood, and little depth.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2012 1 year
I liked this a lot, musty wooden funky and grainy. This is an awesome style that I wish was more popular


2 year 
More subdued funk, charming

Tasted at 3de Gents Bierfestival.  No head, no carbonation.  Im still getting used to this style, I still think its fun, different, and original.  High marks for the great aroma (sour & fruits).  I didnt think it was as complex as rodenbach.

1 year old. Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, woody and light barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Very dry and rather acidic finish. 170712

Samples of barrel 1, 2, and 3 poured at THE FESTIVAL in MA with Andrew. Poured a clear golden body with no head, very minor lacing.  Aroma is funk, light fruit, and a funky aged gouda cheese. Mouthfeel started thin and became fuller by barrel 3. Notes of sour tart fruit, funk, Brett, and aged Gouda.  Overall average for the three barrels would be 3.7 for me.

Keg @ CBCs First Birthday Party. The pour is deep amber orange with no head whatsoever. The nose is resin, some shoe leather, glue and lemon wood. Light cheese. The taste is citrus tang, hints of butterscotch candy. More wood and lemon pith. The finish has sime funky pineapple-spiked cheesiness. Medium body, soft carbonation. Nice.

30th June 2012Keg at Craft and scoop thanks to Jason. Light haze on this gold beer. Light semi dry palate. Pleasant light sourness - citrus and a dash of white wine vinegar. Smooth and tasty. Was surprised how much I enjoyed this.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 Keg at the Craft Beer Co. Pours a clear deep golden colour with almost no head. Just a ring of white bubbles. Aroma is funky and baryard with tart apricots upfront. Little note of dust. Taste is mildly sour and not mouth puckering. Swwet acidic and fruity, with apricots and lemon zast. Very citrusy. Body is medium and almost flat. Overall, oustanding flavour profile for a straight lambic.

Pouring at The Festival in Worcester. This was pouring as Cantillon Single Barrel Lambic 1, 2, and 3  different barrels of the same batch.  All three poured an almost clear gold with a touch of haze, no head.  Still.  Big funk on the nose.  1 was funky, 2 a little cleaner, and 3 started to display more cheesiness.  Lots of funk in the body on all three.  Funky with big brett, two being more subtle than one, and three still having more cheesiness.  Big chewy brett throughout all three.  Big funk.  I scored 1 as a 3.7, 2 as a 3.6, and 3 as a 3.8.

On tap at The Festival in Worcester, session 1. Straw pour with no head. Lemony funk and pronounced Cantillon like acidity give way to musty basement funk and lemon. Not carbonation on it, but very nice dry quenching juicy finish.

Glass at Craft Beer Co. at Toms tasting session. Cantillon 2 year old single cask lambic. Clear amber, no head, no carbonation. Nose is farmyard, acetone, cheesy, Brie or Camembert. Vinegar. Sour and sweet. Caramel. Champagne yeast. Taste is green apple, sour, Bitter. Vinegar, acidic sour finish.

Bottle of 1998 courtesy of ygtbsm94.  Served in a Cantillon wine glass.  Pours a moderate light caramel color with no head or lacing.  Nose brings some light apple cider plus a bit of bread.  Surprisingly malty in terms of the nose, though noticeable malt flavor, and obviously no sweetness.  Moderate acidity and very smooth.  Medium body and dry finish.  Good, but not great.

1998 hand bottle off keg thanks to ygtbsm94. Pours flat lighter amber. Nose is heavier berries, musty, white grapes, noble rot grapes. Taste is bright and very leathery with big wood and orange peel. Sharp. Delicious. Small peach and mango with lemon. Reminds me a bit of the Goldackeral Geuze.

draft at Moeder... I couldnt really tell much of a difference with this young lambic, it was good, not super complex, needs more time

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.Pours a hazy orange yellow colour with a creamy white head. Aroma of sour, ripe fruits and grapefruit. Flavour of strong ripe and sour fruits, apricot, caramel, vinegar and grapefruit. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and high carbonation. Delicious strong fruity and sour finish. Tasty. 8-4-8-4-15 3.9

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere. 2011 vintage. Hazy yellow colour, firm head. Aroma of rich lemon peel notes, fair amount of sweetness, leather and some grass. Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu.

Reviewed on: 06-20-2010 vintage 98 aged 3 years and kegged in 2001. pours a vibrant ruby orange. no head at all, a few bubbles on the sides. light lemon with light sour tones. very light funk. nice light lemon flavor through out with a strong lemon finish. the funk starts at the beginning but quickly disappears. this is mainly lemon through out with very little other sour flavors except some light grape and apple at the very end. very light and easy. virtually NO carbonation at all. body feels a bit thin. this is painfully easy to drink and insanely delicious. very refreshing through out and no overly anything.

Had on tap at Moeder Lambic. Pour is a peachy yellow, mostly transparent with a thin off white head.  The nose has a touch of lemon with a nice dusty funk to it, cob webbs and light leather, more lemon with some golden fruits faintly weaved in at the end.  The taste is extremely dusty and funky, very old bookshelf.  There is some tart lemon that comes in as peaches, golden fruits and some floral bitter hops present themselves behind in order.  The body is light, very gentle, soft carbonation and rather dry in the finish.  Funky is the focus, age may add some fruit as this is probably a newer oude lambic.

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Orange coloured and very clear. Tiny white thin bubbly head that soon fades. Aroma is very sour, bit of lemon and lots of stinky funkiness. Lovely taste, sourness and almost vinous, maybe a bit of wood too, or was it my imagination. Touch of citrus. Very flat and soft in the mouth. Finish is mellow and fruity. Lovely!

From draft at DHVL. Together with The Troch and Mort subite.
Pours yellow, a bit more head then the others but dissapears pretty quick.
No carbonation. The typical Cantillon lambik taste, I really miss the soureness in their lambik, it has almost none. It is cellar, old hops, dusty though.
Not the best lambik of all 3, I prefer Mort Subite. An easy one for blind tasting though.

Sample at the brewery from Jean. 18 month old lambic that was completely still. It reminded me of the geuze obviously except the palate was thinner and there was less complexity. Though it was still a great tasting beer.
From the brewery, pour is a nice pale yellow, the taste is much lighter in souriness then blended gueuze. I would definitely have liked a bit more life to come out. But it has a light souriness.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2012 Cask at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, Belgium august 2011. Godlen, big white head. Vinegar aroma, sour. Really sour taste, I don´t like it. 

juli 2012 at Cantillon Bruwery/Museum in Brussles. 16 months old lambik (or lambik wannabe, not ready yet). Exciting test: Golden copper beer with no head. Sour, citrus, grape. Similar flavour. Nice one, not to sourish. 7 - 5- 7 - 5 -14 this time:-)

Cask at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Orange beer, quite big white head. Sour rubber aroma, fruity, grapefruit, wet grass. Sour vinous flavor, rubber, grapefruit, perfume, some wet grass. Quite balanced, maybe not as sour as many other Cantillon beers.

2yr old, draught at GBBF 2011. It pours flat golden yellow. The nose is sour farmyard, soft fruit, light spice, cider and wood. The taste is hay, grass, wheat, tart lemon, tangy lime, grapefruit, white grape, cheese, wood and mouth-puckering sourness, with a pleasant dry-tart finish. Light body and next to no carbonation. Massively drinkable and thirst-quenching.

Draught at GBBF 2011.
Clear orange coloured with a small white head.
Light acidic and fruity aroma of barnyard.
Light acidic flavour of barnyard, berries and oak.
Tart finish of oak.

Bottle from 4th May, 2010. Poured a pale straw colour with a fair beige head. Great lemony sour aroma with some barnyard mustiness and barley. Lingering lemony sour flavour, barnyard funk again and a backbone of barley and honey. Superb!

Transparent Honey Gold, large bubbled white head that stays. Extremely dusty nose, honey and more wood than the jonge, paper and pulpy grapefruit underneath. Really thin grapefruit body, light lemon and white wine, warmth bringing paper and grapefruit, though in contrast. Lower carbonation than Ive had in most unblended lambic. One of the most dichotomous beers Ive had.
Lambic cask 18 month at moeder lambic. Orange pour with white head . Body has no carbonation. Light nut, woody, light tartness and almost dusty flavor with hints of fruit and wheat.

Durchgängig präsente Säure, die aber nur wenig vordergründig ist. Mild, etwas nach Milchsäure, später etwas weniger sauer, nur wenig fruchtig, dafür sehr ausgewogen. 	 
Test vom 29.5.2007, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 11,12,13,13,-,13 - 12,63

Rating of a 15 months old Lambic, 27 May 2011
Light golden colour, no carbonation, no head. Aroma of brett, honey, tartness, stables, some light pepper. Quite floral. Flavour pronounced Cantillon tart, wood, bit of vanilla, quite astringent, minerals, slight white wine (steen/chenin blanc). Lingering sourness and slight astringency in the finish. Very enjoyable.
(Served from ceramic jug @ the brewery, Brussels)

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Clear golden/amber - no head. 
Nice woody. Nice mellow sourness. Tartness. Fruity notes. Light honey notes. Peppery.

On draught (2-year-old) at GBBF, day 4 on 4 August 2006. Amber colour. Slight haze. Very flat, very sour, very lemony. Some funky farmyard elements. Distinct farmhouse cider similarities. As usual, I prefer the gueuze to the straight lambic but still a rare and enjoyable treat.

From a keg at Cantillon Brewery.  2009 vintage, 1.5 - 2 years old.  Mostly clear amberish pour, minimal carbonation/head.. pretty much flat.  Funky notes, hay, leather, fruit, some tartness, but overall not too sour.  Decent, but I was expecting more from this.  Still I am very glad to have tried it.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas.  Little or no head with a few bubbles on top...definitely hazy orange hue.  Lightly funky aroma; dried peaches and slight apricot in the aroma.  Nicely sour taste, dry fruit, and a very dry finish and a touch minerally.  Very still and medium to thinner body.  Nice.

[3318-20100809] Ceramic jug. Very mild barrel and yeast hints in the aroma with a hint of orange. Slightly hazy, medium bright orange body with quick off-white bubbles. Woody sour barrel yeast flavour has hints of cereals and sourness throughout. Medium body is quite sour. Initial sourness dissipates after a while.
(Vintage 2008 @ brewery, Brussels, Belgium)

Slightly hazey gold with no head.  No real head, just some bubbles.  Slight grapefruit-peel bitter-tartnerss, slightly malty undertones.  Carbonation essentially absent of course.  

Notes: On hand pump at the brewery at Nov 10 open brew day
Pitcher @ the brewery. 1,5 year (relatively young) oude lambiek . Pours dark yellow, clear, headless and flat. Notable residual sugars on a dusty attic sourness. Interesting sample.

My first unblended lambic, straight from the barrel and into my tasting glass at Cantillon - a fantastic treat from a most generous, dedicated and friendly staff! :-D This is a brew now devoid of carbonation, waiting to be infused with a younger, fiery lambic counterpart to produce the famous geuze of Cantillon. A golden, liquid-honey-like body rests elegantly in my glass. Aroma is quite vinous, with sour barnyard hints, dry grapes and yeasty notes lingering around consistently. Taste is sour and tarty at first, then yeasty, then oak comes in before barley malt finally takes over towards the end. Very fascinating build-up on the taste. Palate is completely flat, but still quite drinkable and rather well suited to the characteristics of the taste profile. A strange, interesting, smooth and...flat brew. Enjoyable.

Draught at Moeder Lambic. Big, dusty, sour nose. Fruity. Deep amber-orange color with a loose, bubbly head. Hugely sour flavor, very dusty and dry, with lemon, yogurt, vinegar. Boldly sour. Almost flat, smooth body. Nice aroma, while the taste is overwhelmingly sour and dry.

2010-08-09. Golden body is near headless. Aroma is mild, light barnyard and funk are stealthy, slowly but surely invading your nose, woody accents. Flavour is modestly sour, it is drinkable enough that I get distracted by conversation and neglect my notes for a time. Very light woody character, dry in the finish, very light funk. it is much less intense than say the gueuze. The more delicate nuances are quite subtle, with occasional bursts of intensity. 7+ Average to light palate suits it. Sourness is cumulative, and you notice it much more in the second half of the glass. Very good, I found this quite interesting and surprisingly drinkable, but I would have to be in the right mood for more.  December 2008 vintage from a ceramic carafe/jug at Cantillon, Brussels

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2010 Jean Van Roy was kind enough to draw me a glass from the barrel , which he said was 18 months old.

Gold in color with no head but good air retention. Smells like minerals. Tastes like minerals and white wine. The vinous quality tastes almost like plastic. Thin mouthfeel, little of the trademark funk or sourness. Moderate oak, though.

Very interesting to try, but ultimately I prefer Cantillons lambic older (Bruoscella Grand Cru) or blended.
user_location: The Court of the Crimson King, California, USA

text:
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2011 Remise à jour de ce rating. Cuvée Nov 2009 @ Cantillon, dégusté en fev 2011.

Nettement plus dappréciation pour cette dernière, aussi dégusté dans de meilleures conditions. Cette bière continue de développé un aspect unique rappelant des fruits sec verts, allant de la groseille au sureau pour une faible carbonation. Intéressant que Cantillon venait de faire un brassin ce jour et lodeur dans la brasserie était comme celle du verre, pas mal de grains, notes de fourrage.

tap @ Cantillon.
golden haze, no head.
aroma of vinegary, some light fruit notes of unripe fruits.
flavors, light acidic palate with a lingering vinegary. Fruit notes of peach, apple, tart with a light wood mouthfeel.  Some residual sweetness to be noted although the funk and tartness remain highly present.
Draft. 2 years old. Cloudy golden color with a very small white head. Aroma of dust, must and sourness. Taste is sour with lemon juice, citrus and a dry citrus ending. Good lambic.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2013 Smelled of sour funky fruit. A little cheesy smell to it. Looked goldenish and as flat as still mead. Tastes about how one would expect after smelling it. The same smells were present in the taste. It is very sour, much more sour than imaginable. But refreshing and crisp with a nice tartness that doesnt want to leave your mouth. Ever! I really like this beer. I cant explain why, because I absolutely love RIS and this is the polar opposite.

Tap at DHVL, 2 years old I think. Pour is mostly flat. Aroma is big mint, twigs, tobacco, not too much in the way of sour. Nice body, very cheesy, mild must, cabbage, wild mushroom, lemon. Again, sour is surprisingly light for an oude lambik, though I guess this one stil has another year to go for full funk.

In short: A dry glace of apple juice.  Fun and different experience.  I prefer Cantillon bottles.
How: Hand-pumped at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels Belgium
The look: Almost clear golden blonde body with almost no head
In long: Staff at Moeder told me it was a three year old lambic.  Nose is slightly barnyard with apples notes.  Body is juicy and carbonation is almost nonexistent.  Taste is far from intense.  Breakfast apple juice, dried up green and red apples, wood, some dust.  I drank so much lambic during my last stay in Belgium that a deaf and blind person could easily follow me.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2010 Tap at the Cantillon public brewing session in March 2010.  Lambik dated December 2008.  Hazy yellow, three bubbles.  Aroma of citrus, sour apples.  Taste is tart, light bodied, fruity.  Very nice. 3.6
Second sample at the brewery on 14/9/10.  No head.  More body, more intense sourness than the previous tasting. 4.0

Very big thanks to magicdave6 for this one. Looks good in the glass, dark orange, zippy. Starts mpdest sourish, fruity with notes of apple and lemon. Also a bit salty. Finish prickly-fruity for a moment, aftertaste dry and a bit moldy. Very drinkable. I really liked it!

Draft @ Moeder Lambik, Brussels. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with a small bubbly off-white head. Has a fruity slightly tart grapefruit aroma. Fruity and slightly tart flavor with some hints of berries and grapefruit. Has a fruity malty slightly tart finish.

Keg (Gallows Bird, Espoo)
Magnificent sharp crisp aroma - fruity berries briefly appear, as does a dry woodiness. Silky palate, and a beautiful sour tingle, though the carbonations very low. Vanilla aand fruity sweet aspects, but the sticky rsiny woodiness is grat. Some grapefruit bitterness. All in beautiful balance, even though its simple

(Gravicask at GBBF, London Earls Court, 5 Aug 2009. 2 years old) Hazy copper colour with no head. Tart, sourish nose with notes of stable, barnyard, sweaty horse and lemony citrus. Acidic, tart taste with rhubarb, grapefruit, lemon and horse blanket. Rather light body. Dry, harsh and tart. A bit rough around the edges but a nice lambic.

(Draught, 2007 vintage, at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2009-08-17) Pale orange and hazy. Hardly any head. Sourness, fruitiness and grapefruit in aroma. Medium bodied and dry palate with quite low carbonation. Grapefruit, sourness, fruitiness, bitterness and wood in taste. Grapefruit and fruitiness in aftertaste.

Davvero da bere a litri, ma io forse non sono tanto imparziale siccome amo il lambic serio sopra ogni bevanda; alla spina al BQ del Polli, accompagnato con un panino generosamente stracolmo di prosciutto e formaggio alpino.

Very acidic and dry, not stingy at all, but quite smooth, fruity and wheaty aroma. Wheaty, dry and tart flavor of apricots. Medium-bodied, dry and very flat-carbonated palate. Surprisingly smooth and tasty brew even without carbonation.
Draught @ Pikkulintu. Golden yellow colour, no head. Sour scent. Teeth-dissolving taste with hardly any other components than sourness. Quite delicious.

Aromas of soggy cornflakes dressed with lemon juice.  In the mouth it is wonderfully soft yet pretty in-your-face.  With a slight hint of wood.  It is a simple beer really. Tooth tingling and with a weird residue.  Not quite as wonderful as I have been brought to expect.

Hand pumped at Moeder Lambic. Pours hazy peach minimal lacing. Aroma is a bit tart and a bit acidic. Some hints of peach. Taste is light tart, light acidic. Dry finish. All is in finesse and subtitle here. One could say it is watery but I found it really interesting. It is utterly drinkable for a lambic and would the best thing to get someone started on lambic. It was delightful, an experience in itself.
(Draught)  Pours a golden orange body with no head.  Aroma of dust, basement, grass, and lemon.  Flavor of grass, lemon, and white grapes with a dry finish.
Draught at W.O.S.F. Cloudy golden coloured with no head. Aromas of barnyard, musty basement, honey and some balsamic vinegar. Tart and dry flavour with notes of rubber, citrus fruit and pear.
Draught  Hazy blond to orange body.  Aroma of orange, citrus, grass, barnyard, bit apricot, ...  Moderately sour, lightly bitter flavour with typical Cantillon citric touch.  Quite soft, but ok.
Hazy dull straw.  The aroma is surprisingly hoppy, minty with some honeyed malts and perhaps just a hint of pedio.  Phenolic, but minty with an understated herbal dryness.  Very different example.

WSF. Hazy golden and flat. Fruity aroma has not a lot of funk. Some plums, grapes, and pears. Is flat. Has bitterness in the finish. Nice hops, herbs, wood, and fruit peels. Actually a fascinating example because of all the outgoing hop bitterness. Yum.
Tap @ WSF. Pours a muddy golden with no head. Tart and mouldy cellar nose. Grape, mould and dust before a tart and dry end. Good.

Tap @ Moeder Lambic (2 years old according to the bartender).  Pours hazy bright orange with a ring of bubbles.  Aroma of acetic acid and apple juice.  Taste is slightly tart with more acetic acid and apple juice flavors.  Finishes sour.  Similar to the Girardin, though not as yeasty and a bit more bitter in the finish.
really liked this, solid flat pour, sudden prominant aroma, subtleties rule in this, and it is my gentelmans drink.

From a jug at the brewery, batch from Winter 2007/2008 sampled in October 2008. Pours orange, almost clear with almost no carbonation and no head. Malty and spiced aroma. Flat and light citric initial flavoured. Mild bitter and spiced too, didn’t have any sweetness to it. I dont really understand the hype for this unfinished product.

Cask, BSF at the 2008 GBBF. Pale copper, no head, but pretty just the same. Salty preserved lemon aroma, apricot pits. Lemon and dry lumberyard flavor. Delicate, soft acidity. Far softer, more balanced and drinkable than the Canitillon gueze. Really nice.

Cask at GBBF with in the face with the leg of a barstool tasting. Alround rating: Alround awsomeness, i was in a dilema over between this and the guirardain lambic. However the aciditidy iof cantillon stopped it from being yee haa awsome. Id love the both at any one time. Outstanding. A pleasure to have been in its presence.

18 months old lambiek, draught at GBBF 08. Hazy golden with a few bubbles alongside the glass.Complex vinous aromas with lemons, a hint of wood and grapefruit. Mouthpuckering and uncompromising, lemons in the lead, dry. Relatively light-bodied. One of a kind.

Draught @ 17th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008.Light unlear medium orange color with a virtually none appearance, virtually none lancing head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, gum, wood, sourness. Flavor is moderate sweet and sour with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. (240508)
Draught. Golden with white head. Floral and nice but doesn’t stand out. For a Geuze I prefer Boon Oude Geuze Mariage Parfait.

Aroma:  some musty/earthiness, some sand, some grape skins, some pear brandy, some woodiness

Appearance:  golden, honey, yellow-orange

Flavor:  honey, light fruit, some earthiness/minerals, finish strong with lactic acid

Palate:  overly lactic aftertaste
Draught @ Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008. Clear amber with no head. Mild applejuice flavor with woody notes. Ends mild sour.

Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2008.  Lightly hazy honey color.  Nose of honey and vegetal malt, and tastes of some lactic fishy notes and some sharp liquor and white wine as well.  Not as good as the jong but still nice enough.

Draught yesterday @ Spontaniousweekend 08. 
Hazy golden color, no head. 
Aroma  sourness, lambic, wood. Medium body.
Taste malts, fruits, sourness, dry.
Refreshing.

On tap @ Moeder Lambic. Opaque beer, no head, the color of fresh apple cider. Lemony and funky-sour apple nose. Sour and earthy flavor with citrus and harsh apple-skin. Difficult but very interesting. Just a touch of acid, mostly flat. Love going back to ponder it again and again.
Tap. Nice hazy golden with orange hues and no head at all. Very fruity, peaches, apples, lemons, wood, little barnyard, nice sourness, very refreshing and dry.

A Mes rate: 
Draught at Bruxellensis. Slightly hazy dark gold. Great aroma of whiskey, plenty tannin and dry and earthy. Flavour as the nose but with a lovely mellow dry and tart finish. Glorious lambik, entirely as expected.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2011 Bruxellensis. 3 years old. Very intense aroma.  Honey, grapefruit, lemon, wood. Oaky flavor. All what I found in the aroma comes back with the same complexity and intensity. No carbon, off course, totally flat. Close to perfection.

Cask @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Tasted april 2011. Vinegar and oak in the aroma. Soda, loads of oak, lemon and honey in the flavor. Clear cellar notes. Very interesting lambic, not as good as the best Ive tasted. But I leave the rating as it is.
Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 07. Amber of color , no head. An aroma with notes of oak and grapefruit, no sweets. A sour flavor with notes of oak and citrus, no sweets and a dry finish

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2013 Re-rate 10/8/13: From a ceramic jug at the brewery in Brussels. 1 year old. Hazy yellow-golden with no head.. Lovely aroma of barnyard. Sourish flavor with barnyard, a light sweetish touch and some fruitiness. Light to medium-bodied, very smooth mouthfeel. Really nice, extremely quaffable. 8/3/8/4/17=4

Re-rate 3/5/11: Cask at the brewery in Brussels. Hazy golden with no head. Aroma of fruits (lots of citrus), sweat and oak. Sour oaky flavor with a bit of cheese. Flat palate. 8/3/7/4/15=3.8

Cask at the brewery. Orange color with no head. Acidic aroma of lemons and barnyard. Very sour, funky and bretty flavor with citrus and some astringency. A very dry finish with a touch of bitterness. Medium-bodied and totally flat. 8/3/9/3/17=4

Refreshing and very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2009 2 years old draught at the GBBF 2007. Yellow with a small white head. Grapefruit, lemon aroma, obvious cantillon character. Tart and acidy, lemonjuice flavour, clean finish.
Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2009: I note some oak and hops, as well as a hint of solvents in the aroma. Touch of hops in the flavour too, and not too acidic.
